title: Question 7
prompt: What type of story is this likely to be?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
In the past, Dupin solved a murder: “[The narrator is sitting with his friend Auguste Dupin, thinking about the mystery of the murder of Marie Roget in the Rue Morgue, which Dupin previously solved.]” At the beginning of this excerpt, the reader learns that the Prefect is in the Parisian police. He comes to talk about “official business” that is causing “trouble,” so the story is probably about some kind of crime. Dupin also calls the problem a “mystery.” The story is likely to be a detective story.


“‘Perhaps the mystery is a little too plain,’ said Dupin.”
